com.conceptwave.scripting
Class AuditLog

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.Log
      com.conceptwave.scripting.AuditLog

public class AuditLog
extends Log

CwfScriptAuditLog is intended to be used by applications to record certain "auditable" events separately from normal logging. The AVM will expose the this class as a scriptable object named "AuditLog". This object will be used to append messages to the audit log file. The BUC requires that auditing is always on so there is no need for multiple methods like logging (eg. logError(), logDebug(), etc.).

Method Detail

audit

public static void audit(String rsCode,
                         String[] msgParams,
                         String[] tagValues)
Append a generic message to the audit log. Category of the message logged will be determined by the resource entry matching the Code (See Message Resource Entry section below).

Parameters:
rsCode - (Mandatory) Resource code matching an entry in the system or application resource files (eg appRC_en-xx.xml)
msgParams - (Optional) Array of string parameters to be inserted into the message text. Replacement of parameters is based on position.
tagValues - (Optional): Values portion of the tag value pairs for the log entry. Order of values MUST correspond to order of tags defined in resource entry. Individual entries in the array can be NULL. Will be converted to a JSON string and appear in log statement in between delimiters "SLM=" and "/=SLM"

auditChange

public static void auditChange(String rsCode,
                               String[] msgParams,
                               String[] tagValues,
                               Date dt,
                               String userId,
                               String ip,
                               String objectType,
                               String op,
                               String[] fieldValues)
Append a message to the audit log related to changed information.

Parameters:
rsCode - (same as audit method)
msgParams - (same as audit method)
tagValues - (same as audit method)
dt - (Mandatory) Date object value for when the change occurred.
userId - (Mandatory) The userId who caused the change
ip - (Mandatory): IP Address
objectType - (Mandatory): The type of the object that changed (eg. Metadata name)
op - (Mandatory): String enumeration. Values are 'Add', 'Upd', 'Del' which corresponds to create object, update and delete object.
fieldValues - (Optional): Array of Strings. Values are triples of (Path, New Value, Old Value)
